headline: Why The Narrative Around RTX (RTX) Is Shifting After Fresh Price Target Focus
summary: Why the Price Target on RTX Is in Focus The latest change in the price target for RTX has put fresh attention on how investors think about the stock today, even though the specific figures behind that shift have not been disclosed here. Without the detailed commentary that usually explains this kind of move, the update itself still signals that analysts are reassessing the company and its risks, and that sentiment around the shares is evolving. Stay tuned to see how you can track these price...

headline: Consumer confidence sinks, UPS layoffs, RTX ignores Trump threats

headline: RTX (RTX) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
summary: Chris Calio: Thank you, and good morning, everyone.  Delivered strong sales, adjusted EPS, and free cash flow in the fourth quarter, underscoring our momentum and focus on execution across RTX.  On the orders front, we ended 2025 with a full year book to bill of 1.56, resulting in another record backlog of $268 billion, up 23% year over year with roughly $161 billion of commercial orders, and $107 billion of defense awards.

raw.headline: RTX (RTX) Q4 2025 Earnings Call Transcript
raw.summary: Chris Calio: Thank you, and good morning, everyone.  Delivered strong sales, adjusted EPS, and free cash flow in the fourth quarter, underscoring our momentum and focus on execution across RTX.  On the orders front, we ended 2025 with a full year book to bill of 1.56, resulting in another record backlog of $268 billion, up 23% year over year with roughly $161 billion of commercial orders, and $107 billion of defense awards.

headline: A Tiny Defense ETF Just Smashed The S&P 500 By Nearly 30% | PPA VOO
summary: The Invesco Aerospace & Defense ETF (NYSEARCA:PPA) has crushed the broader market over the past year, delivering 44% returns compared to the S&P 500’s 16% gain. This outperformance stems from concentrated exposure to defense contractors that benefit when military budgets expand and geopolitical tensions rise. headline: RTX (NYSE:RTX) Beats Expectations in Strong Q4 CY2025
summary: Aerospace and defense company Raytheon (NYSE:RTX) reported Q4 CY2025 results beating Wall Street’s revenue expectations, with sales up 12.1% year on year to $24.24 billion. The company expects the full year’s revenue to be around $92.5 billion, close to analysts’ estimates. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.55 per share was 5.3% above analysts’ consensus estimates.
